abstract: Oil prices climb for second day, putting United States benchmark crude above $45 a barrel; prices spike 17 percent in two days.
lead_paragraph: The United States benchmark rate passed $45 a barrel on concerns of Middle East turbulence, still 50 percent below last summer’s levels.

headline.main: Oil Prices Jump 17 Percent in Two Days, Despite Glut
headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Jump 17 Percent in Two Days, Despite Glut

snippet: The United States benchmark rate passed $45 a barrel on concerns of Middle East turbulence, still 50 percent below last summer’s levels.
